gravity_system: Engineered Trusses, Loadbearing Walls, Continuous Strip Footings
other_materials: Rigid SM Foam Insulation, Tyvek, Roxul, Poly
key_elements: Diagonal Truss Bracing, Sandwich Walls, Epoxied Dowels, Attic Fire Stops
overall_building_description: The structural design of the building at 6447 Yatton Side Road incorporates a comprehensive load path analysis, ensuring efficient load transfer from the roof to the foundation. The roof system utilizes engineered trusses, designed to accommodate potential snow drift, with trusses fastened into truss plates using 3-inch nails as per the truss manual. The trusses are supported by loadbearing walls, constructed with 29 gauge steel cladding and 2x8 studs at 16 inches on center, providing lateral stability through diagonal bracing systems. The diagonal truss bracing detail specifies 2x4 struts, each 5 feet long, anchored with 3-1/2 inch nails to each truss web member, ensuring the structural integrity of the roof system. The foundation system comprises continuous strip footings, 24 inches wide and 8 inches deep, supporting FW1 sandwich concrete walls. These walls are reinforced with 15M stirrup bars tied to vertical bars at 24 inches on center, with horizontal 10M bars at 16 inches on center on each face. The foundation plan specifies a 6-inch concrete floor with a 32 MPA rating, placed over a minimum of 6 inches of compacted granular 'A' on undisturbed soil, ensuring adequate bearing capacity and deflection criteria compliance. The use of 15M epoxied dowels, embedded 6 inches into existing footings, facilitates shear transfer and load continuity across structural elements. The wall and lintel/beam schedule outlines the use of W12x26 steel beams, supported by 2 stud bearings and 3 king studs, providing robust support for the superstructure. The building's lateral stability is further enhanced by shearwalls and diagonal bracing, with specific attention to the integration of attic fire stops and attic hatches for fire safety and ventilation. The construction details emphasize joint configurations, with 2x6 diagonal braces installed at approximately 45-degree angles, fastened with 3-1/2 inch common spiral nails, and double solid blocking between studs for additional rigidity. The spatial relationships are meticulously detailed, with section callouts such as A/A and P2 linking plans to their corresponding sections, ensuring a cohesive understanding of the building's structural framework. The project adheres to stringent code compliance requirements, with specific references to material grades, bolt sizes, and weld types, ensuring the building's performance under various loading conditions. Fabrication requirements include welding symbols and bolt specifications, such as 1/2 inch bolts staggered at 24 inches on center for steel beam connections, ensuring precise assembly sequences and structural integrity. The assembly sequences are carefully planned, with erection procedures and temporary bracing requirements outlined to facilitate efficient construction. Special conditions, such as site-specific requirements and environmental considerations, are addressed to ensure the building's adaptability to its location. The integration of advanced engineering jargon, such as diaphragm action and composite action, underscores the building's sophisticated structural design, ensuring its resilience and functionality.
